action.action-desc: Mr. Teague introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide travel expenses for family caregivers accompanying veterans to medical treatment facilities.

section.header: Lodging and subsistence for family caregivers

subsection.text: Section 111(e) of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking When any and inserting (1) When any;
in paragraph (1), as designated by paragraph (1) of this subsection—

subparagraph.text: by striking (other than an employee of the Department) and inserting , including a family caregiver (as defined in section 1701(11)) and excluding an employee of the Department,;
by inserting (including lodging and subsistence) after expenses of travel; and
by inserting before the period at the end the following:
the period of time in which such person is traveling to and from a treatment facility; and
the duration of the treatment episode for such person

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new paragraph:
The Secretary may prescribe regulations to carry out this subsection. Such regulations may include provisions—

subparagraph.text: to limit the number of attendants that may receive expenses of travel under paragraph (1) for a single treatment episode of a person; and
to require attendants to use certain travel services.

subsection.text: Section 1701 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraphs:

paragraph.text: The term caregiver services means noninstitutional extended care (as used in section 1701(6) of this title), including homemaker and home health aid services.
The term family caregiver means an individual who—

subparagraph.text: provides caregiver services to such veteran for such disability; and
may or may not reside with such veteran.

subsection.text: Section 111 of title 38, United States Code, is further amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (d)(3), by inserting (including a family caregiver defined in section 1701) after attendant; and
in subsection (f), by inserting (including a family caregiver defined in section 1701) after attendants.
